head.title: Coney Island Street Fight Leads to Fatal Stabbing

identified-content.classifier: Top/News/U.S./U.S. States, Territories and Possessions/New York

hedline.hl1: Coney Island Street Fight Leads to Fatal Stabbing

abstract.p: Thomas Chabran is stabbed to death on Coney Island street while trying to break up fight between friend and another man (S)

block.p: A 28-year-old man was stabbed to death early yesterday on a street in Coney Island, Brooklyn, while trying to break up a fight between a friend and another man, the police said.

The victim, Thomas Chabran, was stabbed in the stomach at 1:30 A.M. yesterday at Mermaid Avenue and West 23d Street, where he was trying to assist a friend who had got into a fight, said Officer Leslie Cardona, a Police Department spokeswoman.
A 28-year-old man was stabbed to death early yesterday on a street in Coney Island, Brooklyn, while trying to break up a fight between a friend and another man, the police said.

The victim, Thomas Chabran, was stabbed in the stomach at 1:30 A.M. yesterday at Mermaid Avenue and West 23d Street, where he was trying to assist a friend who had got into a fight, said Officer Leslie Cardona, a Police Department spokeswoman.
The assailant fled, and there were no arrests yesterday.
The friend, William Bander, 30, was treated at Coney Island Hospital for minor injuries, the police said.
